unnormalised: Property rates in Bandra West have shot up like crazy! A small 1BHK flat, measuring just around 450 sq ft, is now costing anywhere between Rs. 1.5 crore to Rs. 2 crore. Can you believe it? Brokers are quoting even higher, especially for sea-facing apartments. Forget about buying, even renting a place is a headache.
normalised: Property rates in Bandra West have shot up like crazy! A small one B H K flat, measuring just around four hundred and fifty square feet, is now costing anywhere between rupee one point five crore to rupee two crore. Can you believe it? Brokers are quoting even higher, especially for sea-facing apartments. Forget about buying, even renting a place is a headache.

unnormalised: Apparently, the new metro line and upcoming infrastructural developments are to blame... or thank, depending on which side you're on. People are speculating that rates will appreciate further, potentially reaching Rs. 50,000 per sq ft in prime locations within the next 6-12 months. Guess I'll stick to my chai and wait for the bubble to burst (or not!).
normalised: Apparently, the new metro line and upcoming infrastructural developments are to blame... or thank, depending on which side you're on. People are speculating that rates will appreciate further, potentially reaching rupee fifty thousand per square foot in prime locations within the next six to twelve months. Guess I'll stick to my chai and wait for the bubble to burst (or not!).

unnormalised: And if you're looking to invest, areas slightly further out, like Andheri East, offer better deals. You might find a 2BHK for around Rs 1 cr, with sizes ranging from 700-800 sq ft. Still expensive, but relatively more affordable than Bandra, bhai!
normalised: And if you're looking to invest, areas slightly further out, like Andheri East, offer better deals. You might find a two B H K for around rupee one crore, with sizes ranging from seven hundred to eight hundred square feet. Still expensive, but relatively more affordable than Bandra, bhai!
